text:
When an employer meets
the definition of successor in interest (see 29 CFR 825.107(a)) employee
entitlements are the same as if the employee were continuously employed by a
single employer. This includes continuing leave begun while employed by the
predecessor and counting hours of service and periods of employment for the predecessor
when determining employee eligibility for FMLA leave. 29 CFR 825.107
html:
When an employer meets the definition of successor in interest (see 29 CFR 825.107(a)) employee entitlements are the same as if the employee were continuously employed by a single employer. This includes continuing leave begun while employed by the predecessor and counting hours of service and periods of employment for the predecessor when determining employee eligibility for FMLA leave.

 

29 CFR 825.107
